channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Cliff Rescue; INC#0440; 09:03AM; 4040 S Bluff Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/49tx8Ye; #SanPedro; PRELIM: LAFD land, air and sea response to an adult male (landscaper who slipped but did not fall?), who is stranded but physically stable on a seaside cliff approximately 75 feet from the cliff top, and twenty feet above sea level. He does not appear to be injured. LAFD divers swam from their fireboat to assist at the shoreline, as LAFD Rescue Helicopters now hover above. Because of high tide and cold seas, the man will soon be hoisted aboard the helicopter. He will be transferred the care of LAFD ground crews at a bluff top landing zone.; FS 48; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; AO1 AO2 BC6 BT1 BT17 BT2 E101 E205 E248 E3 E48 EM13 H1 H4 HA1 HA4 RA101 RA36 RH114 T48 T5 UR5 UR88; CH7; 12; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire Civilian Fatality 02/10/2024 INC#0066

item.description: Update Civilian Fatality Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0066; 03:45AM; 832 E Manchester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wcMwKa; #GreenMeadows; As firefighters continue their search through the still smoldering debris of the 50' x 100' one-story building that was heavily involved with fire on their arrival, they have discovered the remains of one adult male civilian inside the severely damaged structure. Their systematic search will continue, to assure no other victims were inside the seemingly abandoned building that proved to contain a cannabis operation. The Mayor's Crisis Response Team has been summoned to the scene, and LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Adam VanGerpen remains on site to assist the media. The fire's cause is under active investigation.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC4 CM20 CM22 E203 E21 E215 E221 E233 E264 E266 E3 E33 E46 E57 E64 E65 E95 EA1 EM11 EM13 HR3 JT3 PI2 RA3 RA33 RA803 RA833 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T15 T21 T3 T33 T64 T66 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire 02/10/2024 INC#0066

item.description: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0066; 02:32AM; 832 E Manchester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wcMwKa; #GreenMeadows; 113 LAFD Firefighters took 75 minutes in largely defensive operations to extinguish heavy fire within a well involved 50' x 100' seemingly vacant commercial building that proved to contain a cannabis operation. No injury. Fire cause under active investigation. LAFD Public Information Officer Captain Adam VanGerpen is en route to the scene. ETA 3:00 AM.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC4 CM20 CM22 EA1 E203 E21 E215 E221 E233 E264 E266 E3 E33 E46 E57 E64 E65 E95 EM11 EM13 HR3 PI2 RA3 RA33 RA803 RA833 SQ21 SQ95 T15 T21 T3 T33 T64 T66 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0066; 01:17AM; 832 E Manchester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wcMwKa; #GreenMeadows; PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations on a well involved 50' x 100' abandoned commercial building. ; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC4 CM20 CM22 E203 E21 E215 E221 E233 E264 E266 E3 E33 E46 E57 E64 E65 E95 EM11 EM13 HR3 RA33 RA803 RA833 SQ21 SQ95 T15 T21 T3 T33 T64 T66 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1260; 05:02PM; 134 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3OyUwLB; #Westlake; First arriving 25 LAFD Firefighters took just 12 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in one second floor apartment at a 15,282 square foot / 26 unit / two-story garden style apartment building. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E11 E20 E203 E211 E220 E3 E6 EM11 RA11 RA20 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T3; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1260; 04:50PM; 134 S Bonnie Brae St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3OyUwLB; #Westlake; *Address Tentative* PRELIM: Heavy smoke showing from one second floor unit at a two-story garden style apartment building.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E11 E20 E203 E211 E220 E3 E6 EM11 RA11 RA20 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T3; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

CONCLUDED - Earthquake Mode Complete; INC#0964; 03:07PM; North of Malibu; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/L9zLjxSK9v8anXpcA; Santa Monica Mountains; The Los Angeles Fire Department has completed a citywide survey of critical infrastructure across the City of Los Angeles following a magnitude 4.6 earthquake that occurred at 1:47 PM PST today, centered in the Santa Monica Mountains north of Malibu, California, 38 miles west of downtown Los Angeles. No significant damage was identified and no serious injuries have been reported. Though additional earthquake activity cannot be predicted, firefighters remind you that when shaking starts: Drop, Cover, Hold On! Protect your head and neck while taking cover under sturdy furniture or near a sturdy interior wall, away from windows and doorways until the shaking stops. After you complete a final survey of your home and neighborhood for earthquake damage, and to confirm no one is injured, please take this time to examine and update your disaster supply kit and discuss your household and workplace disaster plans. Helpful information can be found right now at: https://READY.GOV

Earthquake Mode; INC#0964; 01:47PM; North of Malibu; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/L9zLjxSK9v8anXpcA; Santa Monica Mountains; A preliminary magnitude 4.6 earthquake occurred at 1:47 PM PST, centered in the Santa Monica Mountains north of Malibu, California, 38 miles west of downtown Los Angeles. Pursuant to protocol, the LAFD is now in earthquake mode, as personnel from all 106 neighborhood fire stations conduct a strategic survey by land, air and sea of their districts, examining critical infrastructure and areas of local concern across our 470 square mile City of Los Angeles jurisdiction. Once this process is complete and reports are consolidated, assuming there is no significant damage, LAFD Earthquake Mode will be complete. This process typically takes less than one hour. There are currently no initial reports of structural damage or injuries. An update will be provided once LAFD Earthquake Mode is complete. Though no additional earthquake activity is predicted, Firefighters ask you to prepare for any aftershock. If inside when shaking starts: Drop, Cover, Hold On! Protect Your Head and Neck While Taking Cover Under Sturdy Furniture or Near a Sturdy Interior Wall, Away From Windows and Doorways Until The Shaking Stops. After surveying your home and/or workplace for earthquake damage and assuring no injuries, please check on your pets and at-risk neighbors, especially seniors living alone. When you're sure all is OK, and time permits, please help earthquake science and the LAFD by completing this USGS survey: ( https://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/eventpage/ew1707515250/tellus ); Brian Humphrey

Air Ambulance; INC#0805; 12:38PM; 10965 Mt. Gleason Ave; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/UWwvZWvsfindKwMj6; #Tujunga; LAFD ground crews are transporting a critically ill infant *from a nearby home* to the athletic field at Mt. Gleason Middle School, where they will be transferred to an LAFD Air Ambulance helicopter for direct transport to a pediatric specialty care center. No further details.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 E24 E274 EM5 H0F RA74 RH114 T74 T98; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0771; 12:43PM; 520 S Kenmore Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/42BPGmD; #Koreatown; First arriving 32 LAFD Firefighters took just 24 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire within the kitchen area of one second floor apartment at the rear of an 18,783 square foot / 24 unit / four-story garden-style apartment building (3 occupied floors over parking). No injury. Fire cause under investigation. ; FS 6; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E20 E220 E226 E227 E229 E29 E3 E6 EM11 EM5 HR3 RA26 RA35 RA803 RA813 SQ21 T20 T26 T27 T29 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey
